1554050133_1GDzVsFoYamHqWcYBcuvVWFCAt3Y5.body:
You can create it manually:
sudo yggdrasil -genconf > /etc/yggdrasil.conf

https://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:7g7c1BrclpsJ:https://gist.github.com/ValdikSS+&cd=4&hl=ru&ct=clnk&gl=ru
But to ban him without any warning and then just stay quiet about what's going on. Didn't notice how unreliable GitHub is, until now. People really shouldn't use it then, if they care about data they store on git hosting.

> [gitcenter](#comment_396_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): UPD: according to darkraiden, this is probably because of the gist (though why now, not a month ago)?

So it's not a regular ban, but a shadow ban. And you get it after several minutes after posting gist. Maybe they implemented some kind of auto ban system recently and it banned ValdikSS?

1555148481_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
2 weeks ago(almost 2 years after passing a law about banning censorship circumventing tools), Roskomnadzor started making attempts to enforce the law by ordering 10 vpn providers to connect to it's list of banned websites. Only 1 provider(Kaspersky Secure Connection) agreed to comply as of now.
https://www.zdnet.com/article/vpn-providers-pull-russian-servers-as-putins-ban-threatens-to-bite/

Also, "sovereign" internet bill passed it's second reading 2 days ago and there are at least 2 problems with it:
First, it's not about "sovereignty", it's about giving more control over internet to the state. If this bille will pass into a law(and I think it will) then it can create single point of failure of entire russian network as there is paragraph about creating internet traffic flow control center under Roskomnadzor's control(it is russian internet watchdog which is famous for it's attempts of blocking Telegram by banning millions of ip adresses, mostly AWS and Digitalocean). Internet here will get unstable, expensive and slow because lawmakers don't know how it works.
Second problem is something russians are getting used to. It will create yet another hole in national budget. Interesting thing, there was a statement from authors of bill "there will be no costs from national budget", but according to experts it will cost tens of millions of dollars. They broke the law, but will not be punished for that.
https://www.reuters.com/article/us-russia-internet-bill/russian-lawmakers-approve-second-reading-of-sovereign-internet-bill-idUSKCN1RN0UX

And about circumventing state blocklist. Personally, I don't even notice any blocks most of the time, because I always use vpn and in case it stops working i have GoodbyeDPI from ValdikSS installed on my PC. Currently Roskomnadzor blocks mostly Telegram proxies and TgVPN.
